comments:
Linux distro version: RHEL WS release 4 (Nahant Update 4)
Linux kernel version: 2.6.9-42.0.2.EL
Java version: IBM Java JRE "1.5.0"
Eclipse version: 3.2
TM version: RSE-SDK-1.0M5.zip

I install Eclipse and RSE into a new directory.  When I run Eclipse for the first time and try to open the RSE perspective, it displays a dialog with the following error message:

"Problems opening perspective 'org.eclipse.rse.ui.view.SystemPerspective'"

The perspective does not open.  In the PDE Error log there is the following error

If I try to open the RSE perspective a second time within the same Eclipse session, it does open without an error dialog.  The Remote Systems view contains a single entry named 'Local'.  It does not have any expansion twistie or children, so I cannot see any local files/processes.

If I try to create a new Local connection I also get errors.  I select new connection and choose the type 'Local'.  In the next wizard page I enter the name localhost twice and hit next.  An error dialog appears with the following message:

"An error has occurred.  See error log for more details."

It lets me hit Next on the 'Local Files' wizard page.  When I try to hit Finish on the 'Local Shells' wizard page, the dialog does not go away.

There are two errors in the PDE Error Log.  One has the message 'Unhandled event loop exception' with no stack trace.  The other has the message 'java.lang.NullPointerException' with the following stack trace:
